chapter.title: Management interface layout
chapter.para: Here is a screenshot of the PMB management interface. The screen is divided in three sections.
The navigation bar enables you to toggle between the various management interface modules at any time.
Only the modules to which the user has access are displayed.
To the right of the navigation bar, on the same level as the tabs, can be found various links : history,?, edit your account, opac, and logout.

history opens in an iframe (block on the screen) a history of the searches carried out in the PMB management interface . This link is displayed only if you have access privileges to the catalogue tab. For more information about searches, see ; for more information about search history, see .

? gives access to PMB's contextual help. For more information, read the chapter . Contextual help display can be set. For more information, consult the PMB Administrator's Guide, chapter Tools, section Parameters.
edit your account parameters allows access to the preferences of the user connected to PMB.
opac opens a new browser window/tab and displays the OPAC
logout disconnects the current user, and returns to the login screen
The side menu provides access to the various functions within each module.
The central interface is the part of PMB where you can enter or edit information, execute functions, validate updates, etc.
Alerts are displayed to the left under the side menu :

if memberships are about to lapse

chapter.para: Search results are displayed on the interface along with clickable page numbers at the bottom of the screen; this enables you to load specific results pages at once.

By default PMB will display 10 search results on a page; therefore if your search equation has yielded more than 10 results and you wish to access results 11 to 20, you only have to click on page 2 to display them on your screen. You may also use the Next page and Previous page icons on the interface (blue triangles).
